ANDS-Grants.title: Action evaluation and on-ground monitoring of threatened species *
Practical adaptive management for significantly improving threatened species conservation and recovery programs *

ANDS-Grants.description:
<p>Feral cats and foxes, as well as changed fire regimes and introduced herbivores, have caused many species extinctions and remain a serious threat to Australia’s vertebrate species, especially its mammals.
</p><p>This research aims to find the best management actions to reduce the impacts of feral predators, and help restore native animal populations including threatened species.
</p><p>Work will take place at a range of sites across Australia and include case studies of threatened species population recovery
</p>
ANDS-Grants.title: Developing evidence-based management tools and protocols to reduce impacts of introduced predators on threatened mammals
researchers: J C Z Woinarski John Casimir Zichy
